docs.snippet: Eve Merriam, poet and teacher, had long wanted to write a feminist play, and having found role reversal to be a useful device in her feminist theory classes, she decided to use the device in her revue, "The Club." In that "musical diversion," now ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Eve Merriam, poet and teacher, had long wanted to write a feminist play, and having found role reversal to be a useful device in her feminist theory classes, she decided to use the device in her revue, "The Club." In that "musical diversion," now at the Circle in the Square Downtown, four Victorian gentlemen spend an evening at their for-men-only club, talking and singing of women.
docs.abstract: Club, The (Play): Eve Merriam, author, int; illus

docs.snippet: The religious broadcaster Pat Robertson described Islam on Thursday as a violent religion that wants to ''dominate and then, if need be, destroy.'' The comments drew sharp criticism today from Arab-Americans and others.    Mr. Robertson made the r...
docs.lead_paragraph: The religious broadcaster Pat Robertson described Islam on Thursday as a violent religion that wants to ''dominate and then, if need be, destroy.'' The comments drew sharp criticism today from Arab-Americans and others. Mr. Robertson made the remarks on his ''700 Club'' television program after watching a segment about Muslims' views on terrorism.
docs.abstract: Religious broadcaster Pat Robertson describes Islam as violent religion that wants to 'dominate' or 'destroy'; comment draws sharp criticism from Arab-Americans and others; Robertson makes remarks on his 700 Club television program after watching segment about Muslims' views on terrorism; Hussein Ibish, spokesman of American-Arab Anti-Discrimination Committee, likens Robertson's rhetoric to traditional anti-Semitism (M)

headline.main: Islam Is Violent in Nature, Pat Robertson Says
headline.kicker: A NATION CHALLENGED: THE RELIGIOUS RIGHT

docs.snippet: Pat Robertson, the televangelist, told citizens of Dover that they had rejected God by voting their school board out of office for supporting the teaching of intelligent design and warned them not to be surprised if disaster struck. Mr. Robertson ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pat Robertson, the televangelist, told citizens of Dover that they had rejected God by voting their school board out of office for supporting the teaching of intelligent design and warned them not to be surprised if disaster struck. Mr. Robertson has a long record of similar apocalyptic warnings. ''I'd like to say to the good citizens of Dover: If there is a disaster in your area, don't turn to God; you just rejected him from your city,'' he said on his daily television show ''The 700 Club.''
docs.abstract: Televangelist Pat Robertson, speaking on his television show 'The 700 Club,' tells Dover, Pa, citizens that they have rejected God by voting their school board out of office for supporting teaching of intelligent design and warns them not to be surprised if disaster strikes their area (S)

headline.main: National Briefing | Mid-Atlantic: Pennsylvania: Town Is Warned Of God's Wrath

docs.snippet: Laura Walker Snyder, the daughter of John A. Walker Jr., says her father used intimidation and emotional manipulation to try to recruit her and her brother as spies.   In an interview to be broadcast Tuesday morning, Mrs. Snyder said she came very...
docs.lead_paragraph: Laura Walker Snyder, the daughter of John A. Walker Jr., says her father used intimidation and emotional manipulation to try to recruit her and her brother as spies. In an interview to be broadcast Tuesday morning, Mrs. Snyder said she came very close to succumbing to his persuasion six years ago when she was a communications specialist in the Army. ''First he'd break you down,'' she said. ''He'd tell you you were a failure, that you would never amount to anything in life. Then he would say, 'Let me help you make a lot of money.' It was a sales pitch. He tried to make you think everybody was doing it, that this is the way countries were run.''

headline.main: DAUGHTER SAYS JOHN WALKER PRESSED CHILDREN TO BE SPIES

byline.original: By SUSAN F. RASKY, Special to the New York Times

headline.main: THE COST OF LIVING.; Domestic Excitements.

docs.snippet: A meeting of the Colonial Dames of the State of New-York was held at the residence of Mrs. Howard Townsend last Wednesday. An interesting paper was read upon Hendrick Hudson and the earliest voyagers and discoverers of America. The society lays gr...
docs.lead_paragraph: A meeting of the Colonial Dames of the State of New-York was held at the residence of Mrs. Howard Townsend last Wednesday. An interesting paper was read upon Hendrick Hudson and the earliest voyagers and discoverers of America. The society lays great stress upon the fact that its work is not social but historic and patriotic.
